result.execSummary:
All charges against Hector James Borges in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hector James Borges is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hector James Borges

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hector James Borges in court.  Attorney Awni M Yasin in court for Hector James Borges.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter has been reissued as a felony.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Hector James Borges appeared by video.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Hector James Borges.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel renews their motion to dismiss the case. Case will be refiled as a felony. Court denied the defense's motion for dismissal. Defense requested a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Hector James Borges in court.  Attorney Awni M Yasin in court for Hector James Borges.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  This matter is going to be reissued as a felony and the state requests status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. .
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Hector James Borges in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Yasin requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Hector James Borges in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Awni Yasin as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Yasin accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $75.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 7/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Hector James Borges in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/09/2022@1:00pm
